problem:
A student carried out a laboratory experiment to investigate the relationship between the acceleration $a$ of a body and the force $F$ applied to it. During the experiment the student recorded values for the force and measured the associated acceleration.
The following data were recorded.
Draw a labelled diagram of how the apparatus was arranged in this experiment.
answer: trolley, applied force, ticker timer/light gates

problem:
A student carried out a laboratory experiment to investigate the relationship between the acceleration $a$ of a body and the force $F$ applied to it. During the experiment the student recorded values for the force and measured the associated acceleration.
The following data were recorded.
Describe how the student determined the acceleration of the body.
answer: calculate initial velocity and final velocity, measure distance/time interval between velocities, use relevant formula

problem:
A student carried out a laboratory experiment to investigate the relationship between the acceleration $a$ of a body and the force $F$ applied to it. During the experiment the student recorded values for the force and measured the associated acceleration.
The following data were recorded.
Draw a suitable graph to show the relationship between $F$ and $a$.
answer: labelled axes, points plotted, line of best fit

problem:
A student carried out a laboratory experiment to investigate the relationship between the acceleration $a$ of a body and the force $F$ applied to it. During the experiment the student recorded values for the force and measured the associated acceleration.
The following data were recorded.
Explain how your graph verifies the relationship between $F$ and $a$.
answer: straight line through the origin shows $F$ is proportional to $a$

problem:
A student carried out a laboratory experiment to investigate the relationship between the acceleration $a$ of a body and the force $F$ applied to it. During the experiment the student recorded values for the force and measured the associated acceleration.
The following data were recorded.
Use your graph to calculate the mass that had been accelerated.

A student carried out a laboratory experiment to investigate the relationship between the acceleration $a$ of a body and the force $F$ applied to it. During the experiment the student recorded values for the force and measured the associated acceleration.
The following data were recorded.
Sketch the graph that a student would get if they did not account for the presence of a constant frictional force of less than 0.2 N.
answer: a (m s$^{-2}$) vs F (N) graph with a straight line starting at a positive x-intercept.

problem:
In an experiment to measure the focal length $f$ of a converging lens, a student first found an approximate value for the focal length. Then the student set up the apparatus and recorded the image distance $v$ for different values of the object distance $u$.
The following data were recorded.
Describe how the student found an approximate value for the focal length.
answer: focus the image of a distant object on a screen, measure the distance from the screen to the lens

problem:
In an experiment to measure the focal length $f$ of a converging lens, a student first found an approximate value for the focal length. Then the student set up the apparatus and recorded the image distance $v$ for different values of the object distance $u$.
The following data were recorded.
Draw a labelled diagram of the apparatus and clearly identify the distances $u$ and $v$.

In an experiment to measure the focal length $f$ of a converging lens, a student first found an approximate value for the focal length. Then the student set up the apparatus and recorded the image distance $v$ for different values of the object distance $u$.
The following data were recorded.
Describe, with reference to your diagram, how the values for $v$ were determined and measured.
answer: move object/lens/screen, until a sharp image is formed, measure $v$ with a meter stick

problem:
In an experiment to measure the focal length $f$ of a converging lens, a student first found an approximate value for the focal length. Then the student set up the apparatus and recorded the image distance $v$ for different values of the object distance $u$.
The following data were recorded.
Calculate the focal length of the lens using all of the data in the table.
answer: 1/$u$ + 1/$v$ = 1/$f$, 1st calculation of $f$, three further calculations for $f$, average for $f$.

problem:
In an experiment to measure the specific latent heat of fusion of ice.
The following data were recorded.
Draw a labelled diagram of the apparatus used in this experiment.
answer: ice, calorimeter with water, balance, thermometer

problem:
In an experiment to measure the specific latent heat of fusion of ice.
The following data were recorded.
State two steps the student took to prepare the ice taken from the freezer.
answer: crush the ice, dry the ice.

problem:
In an experiment to measure the specific latent heat of fusion of ice.
The following data were recorded.
Describe the importance of each step (crush the ice, dry the ice).
answer: crush the ice: ensure the ice was at 0°C / it would melt faster, dry the ice: no additional water added / only ice added

problem:

The following data were recorded.
Use the data in the table to calculate the energy lost by the calorimeter after the ice was added.

In an experiment to measure the specific latent heat of fusion of ice.
The following data were recorded.
Hence, or otherwise, calculate the specific latent heat of fusion of ice.

A student investigated how the fundamental frequency $f$ of a stretched string of length 70 cm varied with its tension $T$. During the experiment, the length of the string was kept constant, and the student varied the tension.
The following data were recorded.
Draw a labelled diagram of how the apparatus was arranged in this experiment.
answer: stretched string, newtonmeter / weights, tuning fork / signal generator, meter stick / bridges / paper rider

problem:
A student investigated how the fundamental frequency $f$ of a stretched string of length 70 cm varied with its tension $T$. During the experiment, the length of the string was kept constant, and the student varied the tension.
The following data were recorded.
How did the student determine that resonance had occurred?
answer: paper rider fell off / maximum displacement of the string observed

problem:
A student investigated how the fundamental frequency $f$ of a stretched string of length 70 cm varied with its tension $T$. During the experiment, the length of the string was kept constant, and the student varied the tension.
The following data were recorded.
Describe how the student determined (a) the frequency $f$, (b) the tension $T$.
answer: (a) read from tuning fork/signal generator, (b) read from newtonmeter/weights

problem:
A student investigated how the fundamental frequency $f$ of a stretched string of length 70 cm varied with its tension $T$. During the experiment, the length of the string was kept constant, and the student varied the tension.
The following data were recorded.
Draw a suitable graph to show the relationship between $f$ and $T$.
answer: values for $\sqrt{T}$ or $f^2$, $\sqrt{T}$ values, labelled axes, correct points plotted, line of best fit

problem:
A student investigated how the fundamental frequency $f$ of a stretched string of length 70 cm varied with its tension $T$. During the experiment, the length of the string was kept constant, and the student varied the tension.
The following data were recorded.
State the relationship between $f$ and $T$.
answer: frequency is proportional to square root of tension

problem:
A student investigated how the fundamental frequency $f$ of a stretched string of length 70 cm varied with its tension $T$. During the experiment, the length of the string was kept constant, and the student varied the tension.
The following data were recorded.
Use your graph to determine the mass per unit length of the string used in this experiment.

answer: power supply, copper wire, ammeter, voltmeter

problem:

answer: labelled axes, correct points plotted, line of best fit

problem:
In an experiment to investigate the relationship between current $I$ and potential difference $V$ for a length of copper wire the following data were recorded.
Use your graph to calculate the resistance $R$ of the copper wire.

In an experiment to investigate the relationship between current $I$ and potential difference $V$ for a length of copper wire the following data were recorded.
The student used their results to calculate the resistivity of the copper wire. The following additional data were recorded:
length of wire = 65 cm; diameter of wire = 0.32 mm
Describe how the student determined both the length and the diameter of the copper wire.
answer: length: meter stick, diameter: micrometer/digital callipers

problem:

The student used their results to calculate the resistivity of the copper wire. The following additional data were recorded:
length of wire = 65 cm; diameter of wire = 0.32 mm

A meter stick is suspended from its centre of gravity as shown in the diagram. The meter stick is in equilibrium.
Calculate the mass of the apple.
A simple pendulum has a period of 1.24 s. Calculate the length of the pendulum.
A current of 6 A passes a point in a circuit. Calculate the number of electrons that pass that point every minute.
Calculate the electrostatic force between two protons that are $5.6 \times 10^{-15}$ m apart in a vacuum.

The hammer throw is an athletics event where athletes rotate a metal ball, attached to a wire, in a circle before releasing it.
Derive the formula to show the relationship between the radius, velocity and angular velocity of an object moving with uniform circular motion.
answer:
$\theta = s/r$ or $v=s/t$ or $\omega = \theta / t$
combination of two formulae
$v = r\omega$

problem:
An athlete rotates a ball of mass 4 kg in a circle of radius 1.25 m. The ball is moving with an angular velocity of 21.6 rad s$^{-1}$ just before it is released.
Calculate the centripetal force acting on the ball just before it is released.

An athlete rotates a ball of mass 4 kg in a circle of radius 1.25 m. The ball is moving with an angular velocity of 21.6 rad s$^{-1}$ just before it is released.
Calculate the magnitude of the velocity of the ball just as it is released.

The velocity of the ball as it is released is at an angle of 36° above the horizontal. The ball is released at a height of 1.26 m above the ground and lands 3.79 s later.
With the aid of a labelled diagram, resolve the velocity of the ball into its horizontal and vertical components.

The velocity of the ball as it is released is at an angle of 36° above the horizontal. The ball is released at a height of 1.26 m above the ground and lands 3.79 s later.
Ignoring air resistance,
calculate the maximum height above the ground reached by the ball,

The velocity of the ball as it is released is at an angle of 36° above the horizontal. The ball is released at a height of 1.26 m above the ground and lands 3.79 s later.
Ignoring air resistance,
calculate the horizontal distance travelled by the ball in 3.79 s.

A moving-coil loudspeaker is based on the principle that a current-carrying conductor in a magnetic field experiences a force.
A wire of length 65 cm carrying a current of 3 A experiences a force of 7 mN when placed in a magnetic field. Calculate the magnetic flux density of the field when the current is flowing at right angles to the field.

A loudspeaker has a power of 80 mW.
Calculate the sound intensity for a person standing 7 m from the loudspeaker.

A loudspeaker has a power of 80 mW.
This sound intensity is halved for the person when they stand a distance d from the loudspeaker. Calculate d.

A loudspeaker has a power of 80 mW.
After this, the speaker of power 80 mW is replaced by a speaker of power 20 mW. Calculate the decrease in sound intensity level.

The resistance of a semiconductor depends on multiple factors, one of which is temperature.
Calculate the input power supplied to the drill by the 230 V mains supply.

The resistance of a semiconductor depends on multiple factors, one of which is temperature.
Calculate the percentage efficiency of the drill.

Food irradiation is used to delay spoilage and prevent illness caused by microorganisms.
Calculate the maximum energy of the X-rays used for food irradiation.

Food irradiation is used to delay spoilage and prevent illness caused by microorganisms.
How many times bigger is the average energy of the gamma rays than the maximum energy of the X-rays?

A parallel-plate capacitor with metal plates of area 0.0225 m$^2$ are placed 8 mm apart in a vacuum.
A voltage of 3 kV is applied across the plates. Calculate the maximum potential energy stored in the capacitor.

Capacitors and resistors can be combined to create timing circuits such as those used to create the flash on a camera. The circuit diagram below shows a resistor and a capacitor connected in series with a 30 V power supply. The current flowing in the circuit at a given instant is 0.3 mA.
Calculate the potential difference across the resistor at this instant.

Capacitors and resistors can be combined to create timing circuits such as those used to create the flash on a camera. The circuit diagram below shows a resistor and a capacitor connected in series with a 30 V power supply. The current flowing in the circuit at a given instant is 0.3 mA.
Calculate the charge held by the capacitor at this instant.

All matter and energy in the universe must abide by one or more of the four fundamental forces of nature.
Calculate the energy released during this beta-decay.
When an electron and a positron meet. Write an equation that represents this process.

The refractive index of a block of glass for red light is 1.51 and for violet light is 1.53.
Calculate the difference between the speed of the red light and the speed of the violet light as they travel through the block of glass.

A man is competition participants are required to slide from a raised horizontal platform down a 2.4 m long slide. The slide is at an angle of 32° to the horizontal from the platform.
Calculate the height of the platform above the surface of the water.
answer:
slide height = 2.4 sin 32° (= 1.27 m)
total height = 1.27 + 0.9 = 2.17 m

problem:
A man is competition participants are required to slide from a raised horizontal platform down a 2.4 m long slide. The slide is at an angle of 32° to the horizontal from the platform.
Calculate his velocity as he enters the water. Assume that there is no friction on the slide.

Ra–224 is an unstable nucleus of radium.
Write a nuclear equation for this decay.

Ra–224 has a half-life of 3.6 days.
Calculate the total number of alpha-particles emitted per second by a sample of Ra–224 containing 4.7 × 10$^{14}$ atoms.

A high-speed electron that strikes the screen of an oscilloscope produces the green light that is seen.
Calculate the minimum voltage required across the tube to give an electron a velocity of 2.7 × 10$^7$ m s$^{-1}$.

Green light of wavelength 530 nm is passed through a diffraction grating with 400 lines per mm.
Calculate the angle of separation between the second order images.
answer:
$d = \frac{1}{number\ of\ lines\ per\ metre}$
$n\lambda = d\sin i$
$\theta = 25.1$
angle of separation $= 50.2^\circ$
